intro: Pasania carolinae, commonly known as the Carolina pasania, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in shaded woodlands. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
